org.cougaar.util.log
Class Logging

java.lang.Object
  org.cougaar.util.log.Logging

public final class Logging
extends java.lang.Object

Static access to simple logging facilities.

Cougaar components may be better served by using org.cougaar.core.service.LoggingService LoggingService

Method Summary
static Logger currentLogger()
          Return the Logger currently in-force in the current thread, as set by withLogger(Logger,Runnable).
static Logger defaultLogger()
          Returns the default Logger instance - the value returned by currentLogger() if there is no active context.

          Compute the Logging Name of the referenced object.
static Logger getLogger(java.lang.Object name)
          Similar in function to LoggerFactory.getInstance().createLogger(name); except that this accessor memoizes the calls to reduce memory load.

          Similar in function to LoggerFactory.getInstance().createLoggerController(name); except that this accessor memoizes the calls to reduce memory load.

public static LoggerFactory getLoggerFactory()
Alias for LoggerFactory.getInstance()

getLogger

public static Logger getLogger(java.lang.Object name)
Similar in function to 
   LoggerFactory.getInstance().createLogger(name);
 
 except that this accessor memoizes the calls to 
 reduce memory load.

public static void printDot(java.lang.String dot)

getLoggerController

public static LoggerController getLoggerController(java.lang.Object name)
Similar in function to 
   LoggerFactory.getInstance().createLoggerController(name);
 
 except that this accessor memoizes the calls to 
 reduce memory load.

defaultLogger

public static Logger defaultLogger()
Returns the default Logger instance - the value returned by currentLogger() if there is no active context.

withLogger

public static void withLogger(Logger l,
                              java.lang.Runnable r)
Call a runnable in the dynamic context of a particular logger. Anyone within that context can call currentLogger() to get access to an appropriate logger instance. If no such instance has been installed, will use a generic logger with the name "Default". This value may be retrieved by calling defaultLogger().

currentLogger

public static Logger currentLogger()
Return the Logger currently in-force in the current thread, as set by withLogger(Logger,Runnable).

Returns:
the current logger or the value returned by defaultLogger(). This method will never return null.
See Also:
hasLogger()

hasLogger

public static boolean hasLogger()
Is there a Logger in-force for the current thread?

Returns:
true IFF currentLogger would return something other than the default logger.

getKey

public static final java.lang.String getKey(java.lang.Object x)
Compute the Logging Name of the referenced object. Used by various objects which can create Logger instances.
